channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Trump has set his sights on Greenland, Colombia and beyond. That’s why expansionism is the Word of the Week
This Week in Explainers: Why the anti-Khamenei uprising is Iran’s most powerful yet
In Photos | How a deadly garbage avalanche in Philippines left sanitation workers buried
The sky is (bright) pink in Birmingham. Here’s why
Trump's Greenland dream: The potential challenges US could face
Does the ICE agent who shot Minneapolis woman have immunity?
Has UN become obsolete? Why India needs its own sphere of influence
item.description: As great powers retreat from multilateralism and redraw their spheres of influence, the United Nations is no longer shaping the world — it is merely reflecting it

item.title: Venezuela raid shows airpower drives dominance in modern conflicts
item.description: As the US raid on Venezuela, the war in Ukraine, Op Sindoor, and conflicts in West Asia show, it is clear that airpower continues to be the dominant means of prosecuting military operations. Major armed forces around the world are spending more than half of their defence budgets on airpower

item.title: US withdrawal from international organisations: Implications for global order
item.description: Donald Trump’s policy is aimed at strengthening American military prowess, but withdrawing from international commitments in the name of saving money will undoubtedly dismantle the structures that sustained US soft power

item.title: Iran under siege: How internal unrest and external pressure have pushed Khamenei regime to the brink
item.description: The widening divide between Iranian society and the regime is increasingly evident through repeated waves of protest

item.title: Head-on | Could Usha Vance, a practising Hindu, be next US First Lady?
item.description: Whether JD Vance and Usha occupy the White House, or a Democrat wins the next presidential election, US policy on India will continue to reflect its hegemonistic instinct

item.title: Trump’s dystopian order leaves Europe angry and exposed — but India and China may have the last laugh
item.description: Donald Trump’s ‘madness’ threatens to push the world into a crisis rarely seen since World War II. But it does offer new openings for emerging powers long strangled by Western institutional lopsidedness, monopoly and hypocrisy
